content:
Use Pre-Chat API to Pass Customer Information to the Agent

To provide agents with customer information that helps move an interaction forward, send end-user data to the agent console via the pre-chat API.

This recipe combines common use cases as examples of data that you can send to agents using the pre-chat API. First, pass the end user’s login ID to the agent so that verification is done. Then, to prevent loss on large orders, we pass the customer’s shopping cart value to the agent.

Before building this recipe, consider these caveats:

* You can reference fields from the Messaging Session object or the Messaging User object in an auto-response formula template for Start Conversation, End Conversation, and Inactive Conversation.
* Salesforce custom object fields are different from pre-chat custom fields. This recipe references both types of fields.
* Create a JavaScript function to initialize Embedded Messaging and pass web context to the pre-chat API.

The code snippet below demonstrates how to populate visible and hidden pre-chat fields:

<script type='text/javascript'>
    // ...
</script>

If you use an Experience site, review this slightly different code sample. Before you proceed with the code, here are some important things to note:

* Your page or site template must have the Embedded Messaging component.
* An Experience site doesn’t allow you to directly paste in a code snippet. Include Prechat API in the header markup.

The example includes an event listener on userInfo, which sends a logged-in customer’s information directly to the pre-chat form without asking the customer to enter it again.
title: Service Cloud Messaging API
